abstract.p: Imagio Technology Advertising and Public Relations is being acquired by J Walter Thompson; Incepta Group acquires Cunningham Communications; Cunningham will be renamed Citigate Cunningham (S)

block.p: Two agencies specializing in high-technology clients said yesterday that they were being acquired.

Imagio Technology Advertising and Public Relations in Seattle is being acquired by J. Walter Thompson, part of the WPP Group, for undisclosed terms. Imagio, to be renamed Imagio/JWT, will operate as an autonomous unit of Thompson North America; the agency has 90 employees and billings estimated at $75 million.
Two agencies specializing in high-technology clients said yesterday that they were being acquired.

Imagio Technology Advertising and Public Relations in Seattle is being acquired by J. Walter Thompson, part of the WPP Group, for undisclosed terms. Imagio, to be renamed Imagio/JWT, will operate as an autonomous unit of Thompson North America; the agency has 90 employees and billings estimated at $75 million.
Ralph Fascitelli, 48, president and chief executive at Imagio, continues in those posts at Imagio/JWT, as does Tad Harmon, 44, chairman.

And the Incepta Group in London acquired Cunningham Communication in Palo Alto, Calif., a public relations and marketing agency, for a purchase price to be determined that may reach as high as $75 million. Cunningham, to be renamed Citigate Cunningham, has 200 employees in seven offices in the United States and Britain and fee income estimated at $23.4 million.
Andrea Cunningham, 43, chief executive at Cunningham, will continue in that post at Citigate Cunningham. AdMedia Partners in New York represented Cunningham in the sale.
